snippet: A federal appeals court’s decision limits the legal exposure of companies from the rising cost of class-action lawsuits over unpaid overtime and other wage violations.
abstract: United States Court of Appeals rules employers can require their workers to sign arbitration agreements waiving all rights to class-action lawsuits over workplace grievances; ruling, overturning National Labor Relations Board decision, limits the legal exposure of companies from the rising cost of suits over unpaid overtime and other wage violations.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court’s decision limits the legal exposure of companies from the rising cost of class-action lawsuits over unpaid overtime and other wage violations.

headline.main: Court Blocks Labor Board on Lawsuits
